JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Kristina Pardalos;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: The applicant , Mr Ersin PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by Mr S. GPE , a lawyer practising in GPE .

On DATE the applicant , who was DATE at the time , and CARDINAL other persons were arrested by officers from the ORG police station in GPE on suspicion of having been involved in a theft . According to the arrest report , during their arrest the arrestees cut themselves with pieces of glass which they had on them in protest at their arrest . The arrest report was not signed by the applicant or the other arrestees .
On DATE the applicant was examined by a doctor , who noted a graze of MONEY on his left shoulder blade . The doctor also noted that the applicant was not fully conscious .

On DATE the applicant was once again examined by a doctor , who noted that there were incisions on the applicant ’s abdomen and CARDINAL superficial grazes of QUANTITY on his left shoulder blade and left shoulder . According to the medical report , the applicant stated to the doctor that the incisions had occurred when he had cut himself . He further stated he had been hit on the head . Noting that the applicant was not fully conscious , the doctor referred the applicant to a hospital for a neurological consultation .

On DATE the applicant underwent a neurological examination , following which the director of the GPE branch of ORG informed the police that no objective neuropathological finding had been observed on the applicant and that there had not been any trace of trauma on the applicant ’s head . The director further informed that there was a graze of QUANTITY on the applicant ’s left shoulder . The applicant was subsequently detained within the context of the criminal proceedings brought against him , which resulted in his acquittal on CARDINAL DATE .

Meanwhile , on DATE the applicant submitted to the GPE public prosecutor ’s office that he had been beaten while in police custody . He claimed that the police officers had thrown him on to the floor and kicked him . He had also been hit on the head . In support of his allegations , the applicants referred to the grazes found on his left shoulder blade and left shoulder . The applicant noted that CARDINAL police officer , GPE , had rescued him from another officer who had been beating him . On an unspecified date one of the other arrestees , ORG , also made a formal allegation of ill - treatment .
On DATE the GPE public prosecutor filed a bill of indictment with ORG , charging CARDINAL police officers with inflicting ill - treatment upon the applicant and GPE

During the trial , ORG heard the complainants , the accused and certain witnesses , including ORG brother , who noted that ORG had been under the influence of drugs and had not been ill - treated when he had seen him in the police station . A certain GPE submitted that he was a friend of the applicant and that he had not observed that any illtreatment had been inflicted on the applicant when he had gone to the police station . Finally , GPE stated before the court that he had not been in the police station on DATE . The court also took the medical reports of CARDINAL and DATE into consideration .

On DATE ORG acquitted the police officers , holding that there was insufficient evidence against them . The court noted that the ORG statements had been contradictory and that the witness statements did not correspond to the ORG allegations .
The applicant appealed . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of the first - instance court .
